00013 // opaque types for the users of jgraphics
00014 #ifdef __cplusplus
00015 struct t_jgraphics;
00016 struct t_jpath;
00017 struct t_jpattern;
00018 struct t_jfont;
00019 struct t_jtextlayout;
00020 struct t_jtransform;
00021 struct t_jsurface;
00022 struct t_jpopupmenu; 
00023 struct t_jsvg; 
00024 #else 
00025 typedef struct _jgraphics   t_jgraphics;    ///< An instance of a jgraphics drawing context.    @ingroup jgraphics
00026 typedef struct _jpath       t_jpath;        ///< An instance of a jgraphics path.               @ingroup jgraphics
00027 typedef struct _jpattern    t_jpattern;     ///< An instance of a jgraphics pattern.            @ingroup jpattern
00028 typedef struct _jfont       t_jfont;        ///< An instance of a jgraphics font.               @ingroup jfont
00029 typedef struct _jtextlayout t_jtextlayout;  ///< An instance of a jgraphics text layout object. @ingroup jgraphics
00030 typedef struct _jtransform  t_jtransform;   ///< An instance of a jgraphics transform.          @ingroup jgraphics
00031 typedef struct _jsurface    t_jsurface;     ///< An instance of a jgraphics surface.            @ingroup jsurface
00032 typedef struct _jsvg        t_jsvg;         ///< An instance of an SVG object.                  @ingroup jgraphics
00033 typedef struct _jpopupmenu  t_jpopupmenu;   ///< An instance of a pop-up menu.                  @ingroup jgraphics
00034 #endif

00049 
00050 /** Determine the coordinate of the bottom of a rect.
00051     @ingroup    jgraphics   */
00052 #define JGRAPHICS_RECT_BOTTOM(rect)     (((rect)->y)+((rect)->height))
00053 
00054 /** Determine the coordinate of the right side of a rect.
00055     @ingroup    jgraphics   */
00056 #define JGRAPHICS_RECT_RIGHT(rect)      (((rect)->x)+((rect)->width))

00059 // misc utilities
00060 
00061 /** Utility macro to return the value of Pi.            @ingroup jgraphics */
00062 #define JGRAPHICS_PI        (3.1415926535897932384626433832795028842)
00063 
00064 /** Utility macro to return the value of twice Pi.      @ingroup jgraphics */
00065 #define JGRAPHICS_2PI       (2. * 3.1415926535897932384626433832795028842)
00066 
00067 /** Utility macro to return the value of half of Pi.    @ingroup jgraphics */
00068 #define JGRAPHICS_PIOVER2  (0.5 * 3.1415926535897932384626433832795028842)

00074 int jgraphics_round(double d);

00078 // surfaces
00079 
00080 /** Enumeration of color formats used by jgraphics surfaces.
00081     @ingroup    jgraphics           */
00082 typedef enum _jgraphics_format {
00083     JGRAPHICS_FORMAT_ARGB32,        ///< Color is represented using 32 bits, 8 bits each for the components, and including an alpha component.
00084     JGRAPHICS_FORMAT_RGB24,         ///< Color is represented using 32 bits, 8 bits each for the components.  There is no alpha component.
00085     JGRAPHICS_FORMAT_A8             ///< The color is represented only as an 8-bit alpha mask.
00086 //  JGRAPHICS_FORMAT_A1             // not supported 
00087 } t_jgraphics_format; 
00088 
00089 
00090 /** Enumeration of file formats usable for jgraphics surfaces.
00091     @ingroup    jgraphics           */
00092 typedef enum _jgraphics_fileformat {
00093     JGRAPHICS_FILEFORMAT_PNG,       ///< Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format
00094     JGRAPHICS_FILEFORMAT_JPEG       ///< JPEG format
00095 } t_jgraphics_fileformat;

00098 /** Create an image surface.
00099     Use jgraphics_surface_destroy() to free it when you are done.
00100     @ingroup        jsurface
00101     @param  format  Defines the color format for the new surface.
00102     @param  width   Defines the width of the new surface.
00103     @param  height  Defines the height of the new surface.
00104     @return         A pointer to the new surface.       */
00105 t_jsurface* jgraphics_image_surface_create(t_jgraphics_format format, int width, int height);
00106 
00107 
00108 /** Create an image surface, filling it with the contents of a file, and get a reference to the surface.
00109     Use jgraphics_surface_destroy() to release your reference to the surface when you are done.
00110     @ingroup            jsurface
00111     @param  filename    The name of the file.
00112     @param  path        The path id of the file.
00113     @return             A pointer to the new surface.       */
00114 t_jsurface *jgraphics_image_surface_create_referenced(const char *filename, short path);
00115 
00116 
00117 /** Create an image surface, filling it with the contents of a file.
00118     Use jgraphics_surface_destroy() to free it when you are done.
00119     @ingroup            jsurface
00120     @param  filename    The name of the file.
00121     @param  path        The path id of the file.
00122     @return             A pointer to the new surface.       */
00123 t_jsurface* jgraphics_image_surface_create_from_file(const char *filename, short path);
00124 
00125 
00126 /** Create an image surface from given pixel data.
00127     Data should point to start of top line of bitmap, stride tells how to get to next line. 
00128     For upside down windows bitmaps, data = (pBits-(height-1)*stride) and stride is a negative number.
00129     @ingroup            jsurface
00130     @param  data        The data.  For example, an RGBA image loaded in memory.
00131     @param  format      The format of the data.
00132     @param  width       The width of the new surface.
00133     @param  height      The height of the new surface.
00134     @param  stride      The number of bytes between the start of rows in the dat buffer.
00135     @param  freefun     If not NULL, freefun will be called when the surface is destroyed
00136     @param  freearg     This will be passed to freefun if/when freefun is called.
00137     @return             A pointer to the new surface.   */
00138 t_jsurface* jgraphics_image_surface_create_for_data(unsigned char *data, t_jgraphics_format format,
00139                                                     int width, int height, int stride, 
00140                                                     method freefun, void *freearg);
00141 
00142 // Internal Use Only
00143 t_jsurface* jgraphics_image_surface_create_for_data_premult(unsigned char *data, t_jgraphics_format format, 
00144                                                     int width, int height, int stride, 
00145                                                     method freefun, void *freearg);
00146 
00147 /** Create a new surface from file data.
00148     @ingroup        jsurface
00149     @param  data    A pointer to the raw PNG or JPG bits.
00150     @param  datalen The number of bytes in data.
00151     @return         The new surface.
00152     @see            jgraphics_write_image_surface_to_filedata() */
00153 t_jsurface* jgraphics_image_surface_create_from_filedata(const void *data, unsigned long datalen);
00154 
00155 
00156 /** Create a new surface from a resource in your external.
00157     @ingroup            jsurface
00158     @param  moduleRef   A pointer to your external's module, 
00159                         which is passed to your external's main() function when the class is loaded.
00160     @param  resname     The name of the resource in the external.
00161     @remark             The following example shows an example of how this might be used in an external.
00162     @code
00163     static s_my_surface = NULL;
00164     
00165     int main(void *moduleRef)
00166     {
00167         // (Do typical class initialization here)
00168         
00169         // now create the surface from a resource that we added to the Xcode/VisualStudio project
00170         s_my_surface = jgraphics_image_surface_create_from_resource(moduleRef, "myCoolImage");
00171 
00172         return 0;
00173     }
00174     @endcode    */
00175 t_jsurface* jgraphics_image_surface_create_from_resource(const void* moduleRef, const char *resname);
00176

00183 t_jsurface* jgraphics_surface_reference(t_jsurface *s);

00192 /** Export a PNG file of the contents of a surface.
00193     @ingroup            jsurface
00194     @param  surface     The surface to export.
00195     @param  filename    Specify the name of the file to create.
00196     @param  path        Specify the path id for where to create the file.
00197     @param  dpi         Define the resolution of the image (e.g. 72).
00198     @return             A Max error code.   */
00199 t_max_err   jgraphics_image_surface_writepng(t_jsurface *surface, const char *filename, short path, long dpi);

00227 /** Retrieve the color of an individual pixel in a surface.

00236 /** 
00237     @ingroup        jsurface
00238     @param  s       The surface to scroll.
00239     @param  x       The origin of the rect to scroll.
00240     @param  y       The origin of the rect to scroll.
00241     @param  width   The width of the rect to scroll. 
00242     @param  height  The height of the rect to scroll.
00243     @param  dx      The amount to scroll the surface horizontally.
00244     @param  dy      The amount to scroll the surface vertically.
00245     @param  path    Can pass NULL if you are not interested in this info.
00246                     Otherwise pass a pointer and it will be returned with a path containing the invalid region.
00247 */
00248 void        jgraphics_image_surface_scroll(t_jsurface *s, 
00249                                            int x, int y, int width, int height, 
00250                                            int dx, int dy, 
00251                                            t_jpath **path);     //

00253 
00254 /** Get a read-only raw bitmap of a surface.
00255     This gives you a pointer to the raw bitmap data so you can read from it yourself and examine the stuff that was drawn.
00256     The jgraphics_image_surface_lockpixels() version gives you a pointer to the bits that you can directly munge.
00257     After either call you should make the appropriate unlock call.
00258     @ingroup jsurface
00259     @param  s           The surface.
00260     @param  x           The rect horizontal-origin for the raw bitmap.
00261     @param  y           The rect vertical-origin for the raw bitmap.
00262     @param  width       The rect width for the bitmap.
00263     @param  height      The rect height for the bitmap.
00264     @param  linestride  The line stride for the bitmap.
00265     @param  pixelstride The pixel stride for the bitmap.
00266     @return             A pointer to the raw bitmap.        */
00267 const unsigned char* jgraphics_image_surface_lockpixels_readonly(t_jsurface *s,
00268                                                                  int x, int y, int width, int height, 
00269                                                                  int *linestride, int *pixelstride);
00270 /** Unlock a surface locked by jgraphics_image_surface_lockpixels_readonly().
00271     @ingroup jsurface
00272     @param  s       The surface.
00273     @param  data    The pointer returned by jgraphics_image_surface_lockpixels_readonly().  */
00274 void                 jgraphics_image_surface_unlockpixels_readonly(t_jsurface *s, const unsigned char *data); 
00275 
00276 
00277 /** Get a writable bitmap of a surface.
00278     After you are done reading/writing to the bitmap, you should call jgraphics_image_surface_unlockpixels().
00279     @ingroup jsurface
00280     @param  s           The surface.
00281     @param  x           The rect horizontal-origin for the raw bitmap.
00282     @param  y           The rect vertical-origin for the raw bitmap.
00283     @param  width       The rect width for the bitmap.
00284     @param  height      The rect height for the bitmap.
00285     @param  linestride  The line stride for the bitmap.
00286     @param  pixelstride The pixel stride for the bitmap.
00287     @return             A pointer to the raw bitmap.        */
00288 unsigned char*       jgraphics_image_surface_lockpixels(t_jsurface *s, 
00289                                                         int x, int y, int width, int height,
00290                                                         int *linestride, int *pixelstride);
00291 
00292 /** Unlock a surface locked by jgraphics_image_surface_lockpixels().
00293     @ingroup jsurface
00294     @param  s       The surface.
00295     @param  data    The pointer returned by jgraphics_image_surface_lockpixels().   */
00296 void                 jgraphics_image_surface_unlockpixels(t_jsurface *s, unsigned char *data);

00299 /** Draw an image surface.
00300     This not in cairo, but, it seems silly to have to make a brush to just draw an image.
00301     This doesn't support rotations, however.
00302     @ingroup            jsurface
00303     @param  g           The graphics context in which to draw the surface.
00304     @param  s           The surface to draw.
00305     @param  srcRect     The rect within the surface that should be drawn.
00306     @param  destRect    The rect in the context to which to draw the srcRect.
00307     @see                jgraphics_image_surface_draw_fast()     */
00308 void        jgraphics_image_surface_draw(t_jgraphics *g, t_jsurface *s, t_rect srcRect, t_rect destRect);
00309 
00310 
00311 /** Draw an image surface quickly.
00312     The draw_fast version won't scale based on zoom factor or user transforms so make sure that this is what you want!
00313     Draws entire image, origin *can* be shifted via zoom and user transforms
00314     (even though image is not scaled based on those same transforms)
00315     @ingroup            jsurface
00316     @param  g           The graphics context in which to draw the surface.
00317     @param  s           The surface to draw.
00318     @see    jgraphics_image_surface_draw                        */
00319 void        jgraphics_image_surface_draw_fast(t_jgraphics *g, t_jsurface *s);       
00320 
00321 
00322 /** Get surface data ready for manually writing to a file.
00323     @ingroup        jsurface
00324     @param  surf    The surface whose data will be retrieved.
00325     @param  fmt     The format for the data.  This should be a selection from #t_jgraphics_fileformat.
00326     @param  data    The address of a pointer that will be allocated and filled.
00327                     When you are done with this data you should free it using sysmem_freeptr().
00328     @param  size    The address of a variable to hold the size of the data upon return.
00329     
00330     @remark         A good example of this is to embed the surface as a PNG in a patcher file.
00331     @code
00332     long size = 0;
00333     void *data = NULL;
00334     
00335     jgraphics_write_image_surface_to_filedata(x->j_surface, JGRAPHICS_FILEFORMAT_PNG, &data, &size);
00336     if (size) {
00337         x->j_format = gensym("png");
00338         binarydata_appendtodictionary(data, size, gensym("data"), x->j_format, d);
00339         x->j_imagedata = data;
00340         x->j_imagedatasize = size;
00341     }
00342     @endcode
00343     @see            jgraphics_image_surface_create_from_filedata()  */
00344 void jgraphics_write_image_surface_to_filedata(t_jsurface *surf, long fmt, void **data, long *size);
00345 
00346 
00347 /** Set all pixels in rect to 0.
00348     @ingroup        jsurface

00350     @param  x       The horizontal origin of the rect to clear.

00352     @param  width   The width of the rect to clear.
00353     @param  height  The height of the rect to clear.    */
00354 void jgraphics_image_surface_clear(t_jsurface *s, int x, int y, int width, int height);

00479 /** Add a circular, clockwise, arc to the current path.
00480     @ingroup        jgraphics
00481     @param  g       The graphics context.
00482     @param  xc      The horizontal coordinate of the arc's center.
00483     @param  yc      The vertical coordinate of the arc's center.
00484     @param  radius  The radius of the arc.
00485     @param  angle1  The starting angle of the arc in radians. 
00486                     Zero radians is center right (positive x axis).
00487     @param  angle2  The terminal angle of the arc in radians.
00488                     Zero radians is center right (positive x axis).     */
00489 void        jgraphics_arc(t_jgraphics *g, 
00490                           double xc, double yc,
00491                           double radius,
00492                           double angle1, double angle2);
00493 
00494                 
00495 /** Add a non-circular arc to the current path.
00496     @ingroup        jgraphics
00497     @param  g       The graphics context.
00498     @param  xc      The horizontal coordinate of the arc's center.
00499     @param  yc      The vertical coordinate of the arc's center.
00500     @param  radiusx The horizontal radius of the arc.
00501     @param  radiusy The vertical radius of the arc.
00502     @param  angle1  The starting angle of the arc in radians. 
00503                     Zero radians is center right (positive x axis).
00504     @param  angle2  The terminal angle of the arc in radians.
00505                     Zero radians is center right (positive x axis).     */
00506 void        jgraphics_ovalarc(t_jgraphics *g, 
00507                    double xc, double yc,
00508                    double radiusx, double radiusy,
00509                    double angle1, double angle2);

00515     @param  xc      The horizontal coordinate of the arc's center.
00516     @param  yc      The vertical coordinate of the arc's center.
00517     @param  radius  The radius of the arc.
00518     @param  angle1  The starting angle of the arc in radians. 
00519                     Zero radians is center right (positive x axis).
00520     @param  angle2  The terminal angle of the arc in radians.
00521                     Zero radians is center right (positive x axis).     */
00522 void        jgraphics_arc_negative(t_jgraphics *g,

00528 /** Add a cubic Bezier spline to the current path.
00529     @ingroup        jgraphics

00534     @param  y2      The second control point.
00535     @param  x3      The destination point.
00536     @param  y3      The destination point.  */

00704 /** A structure for holding information related to how much space the rendering of a given font will use.
00705     The units for these measurements is in pixels.
00706     @ingroup    jgraphics
00707 */

00709     double ascent;          ///< The ascent.

00711     double height;          ///< The hieght.
00712     double max_x_advance;   ///< Unused / Not valid.
00713     double max_y_advance;   ///< Unused / Not valid.
00714 } t_jgraphics_font_extents;

00884 /** Enumeration of text justification options, which are specified as a bitmask.
00885     @ingroup    jgraphics           */
00886 typedef enum _jgraphics_text_justification {
00887     JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_LEFT = 1,          ///< Justify left
00888     JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_RIGHT = 2,         ///< Justify right
00889     JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_HCENTERED = 4,     ///< Centered horizontally
00890     JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_TOP = 8,           ///< Justified to the top
00891     JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_BOTTOM = 16,       ///< Justified to the bottom
00892     JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_VCENTERED = 32,    ///< Centered vertically
00893     JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_HJUSTIFIED = 64,   ///< Horizontally justified
00894     JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_CENTERED = JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_HCENTERED + JGRAPHICS_TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_VCENTERED ///< Shortcut for Centering both vertically and horizontally
00895 } t_jgraphics_text_justification;
00896

00903 } t_jgraphics_textlayout_flags;

00985 
00986 /** An affine transformation (such as scale, shear, etc). 
00987     @ingroup jmatrix    */
00988 typedef struct {
00989     double xx;      ///< xx component
00990     double yx;      ///< yx component
00991     double xy;      ///< xy component
00992     double yy;      ///< yy component
00993     double x0;      ///< x translation
00994     double y0;      ///< y translation
00995 } t_jmatrix; 
00996 
00997 /** Set a #t_jmatrix to an affine transformation.
00998     @ingroup    jmatrix
00999     @param  x   
01000     @param  xx  
01001     @param  yx  
01002     @param  xy  
01003     @param  yy  
01004     @param  x0  
01005     @param  y0  
01006     @remark     given x,y the matrix specifies the following transformation:
01007     @code
01008     xnew = xx * x + xy * y + x0; 
01009     ynew = yx * x + yy * y + y0;
01010     @endcode
01011 */
01012 void jgraphics_matrix_init(t_jmatrix *x, double xx, double yx, double xy, double yy, double x0, double y0);
01013 
01014 /** Modify a matrix to be an identity transform.
01015     @ingroup    jmatrix
01016     @param  x   The #t_jmatrix.
01017 */
01018 void jgraphics_matrix_init_identity(t_jmatrix *x); 
01019 
01020 /** Initialize a #t_jmatrix to translate (offset) a point.
01021     @ingroup    jmatrix
01022     @param  x   The #t_jmatrix.
01023     @param  tx  The amount of x-axis translation.
01024     @param  ty  The amount of y-axis translation.
01025 */
01026 void jgraphics_matrix_init_translate(t_jmatrix *x, double tx, double ty); 
01027 
01028 /** Initialize a #t_jmatrix to scale (offset) a point.
01029     @ingroup    jmatrix
01030     @param  x   The #t_jmatrix.
01031     @param  sx  The horizontal scale factor.
01032     @param  sy  The vertical scale factor.
01033 */
01034 void jgraphics_matrix_init_scale(t_jmatrix *x, double sx, double sy); 
01035 
01036 /**Initialize a #t_jmatrix to rotate (offset) a point.
01037     @ingroup        jmatrix
01038     @param  x       The #t_jmatrix.
01039     @param  radians The angle or rotation in radians.
01040 */
01041 void jgraphics_matrix_init_rotate(t_jmatrix *x, double radians); 
01042 
01043 
01044 /** Apply a translation to an existing matrix.
01045     @ingroup    jmatrix
01046     @param  x   The #t_jmatrix.
01047     @param  tx  The amount of x-axis translation.
01048     @param  ty  The amount of y-axis translation.
01049 */
01050 void jgraphics_matrix_translate(t_jmatrix *x, double tx, double ty); 
01051 
01052 /** Apply a scaling to an existing matrix.
01053     @ingroup    jmatrix
01054     @param  x   The #t_jmatrix.
01055     @param  sx  The horizontal scale factor.
01056     @param  sy  The vertical scale factor.
01057 */
01058 void jgraphics_matrix_scale(t_jmatrix *x, double sx, double sy); 
01059 
01060 /** Apply a rotation to an existing matrix.
01061     @ingroup    jmatrix
01062     @param  x   The #t_jmatrix.
01063     @param  radians The angle or rotation in radians.
01064 */
01065 void jgraphics_matrix_rotate(t_jmatrix *x, double radians); 
01066 
01067 /** Invert an existing matrix.
01068     @ingroup    jmatrix
01069     @param  x   The #t_jmatrix.
01070 */
01071 void jgraphics_matrix_invert(t_jmatrix *x); 
01072  
01073 /** Multiply two matrices: resulting matrix has effect of first applying a and then applying b. 
01074     @ingroup        jmatrix
01075     @param  result  The resulting product #t_jmatrix.
01076     @param  a       The first operand.
01077     @param  b       The second operand.
01078 */
01079 void jgraphics_matrix_multiply(t_jmatrix *result, const t_jmatrix *a, const t_jmatrix *b); 
01080 
01081 
01082 /** Transform a point using a #t_jmatrix transormation.
01083     @ingroup        jmatrix
01084     @param  matrix  The #t_jmatrix.
01085     @param  x       The address of the variable holding the x coordinate.
01086     @param  y       The address of the variable holding the y coordinate.
01087 */
01088 void jgraphics_matrix_transform_point(const t_jmatrix *matrix, double *x, double *y);

01455 
01456 // utility funtions and macros for new rgba attribtes and legacy rgb attributes
01457 
01458 // don't call these two functions directly, instead use the macros below...
01459 t_max_err jgraphics_attr_setrgba(t_object *x, t_object *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
01460 t_max_err jgraphics_attr_setrgb_alias(t_object *x, t_object *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
01461 
01462 
01463 /**
01464     Create a color (#t_jrgba) attribute and add it to a Max class.
01465 
01466     @ingroup    attr
01467     @param  c               The class pointer.
01468     @param  attrname        The name of this attribute as a C-string.
01469     @param  flags           Any flags you wish to declare for this attribute, as defined in #e_max_attrflags.
01470     @param  structname      The C identifier for the struct (containing a valid #t_object header) representing an instance of this class.
01471     @param  structmember    The C identifier of the member in the struct that holds the value of this attribute.
01472 */
01473 #define CLASS_ATTR_RGBA(c,attrname,flags,structname,structmember) \
01474     {   CLASS_ATTR_DOUBLE_ARRAY(c,attrname,flags,structname,structmember,4); \
01475         CLASS_ATTR_ACCESSORS(c,attrname,NULL,jgraphics_attr_setrgba); \
01476         CLASS_ATTR_PAINT(c,attrname,0); }
01477 
01478 
01479 // for internal use only?
01480 #define CLASS_ATTR_RGBA_LEGACY(c,attrname,aliasname,flags,structname,structmember) \
01481     {   CLASS_ATTR_RGBA(c,attrname,flags,structname,structmember); \
01482         CLASS_ATTR_ALIAS(c,attrname,aliasname); \
01483         CLASS_ATTR_INVISIBLE(c,aliasname,0); \
01484         CLASS_ATTR_ACCESSORS(c,aliasname,NULL,jgraphics_attr_setrgb_alias); }
01485 
01486 
01487 /**
01488     Retrieves the value of a color attribute, given its parent object and name. 
01489 
01490     @ingroup attr
01491     @param  ob      The attribute's parent object
01492     @param  s       The attribute's name
01493     @param  c       The address of a #t_jrgba struct that will be filled with the attribute's color component values.
01494     @return         This function returns the error code #MAX_ERR_NONE if successful, 
01495                     or one of the other error codes defined in #e_max_errorcodes if unsuccessful.
01496 */
01497 t_max_err object_attr_getjrgba(void *ob, t_symbol *s, t_jrgba *c);
01498 
01499 
01500 /**
01501     Sets the value of a color attribute, given its parent object and name. 
01502     The function will call the attribute's <tt>set</tt> method, using the data provided.
01503 
01504     @ingroup attr
01505     @param  ob      The attribute's parent object
01506     @param  s       The attribute's name
01507     @param  c       The address of a #t_jrgba struct that contains the new color.
01508     @return         This function returns the error code #MAX_ERR_NONE if successful, 
01509                     or one of the other error codes defined in #e_max_errorcodes if unsuccessful.
01510 */
01511 t_max_err object_attr_setjrgba(void *ob, t_symbol *s, t_jrgba *c);
01512 
01513 
01514 /** Get the components of a color in an array of pre-allocated atoms.
01515 
01516     @ingroup color
01517     @param  argv    The address to the first of an array of atoms that will hold the result.
01518                     At least 4 atoms must be allocated, as 4 atoms will be set by this function
01519                     for the red, green, blue, and alpha components.
01520     @param  c       The address of a #t_jrgba struct from which the color components will be fetched.
01521 */
01522 void jrgba_to_atoms(t_jrgba *c, t_atom *argv);
01523 
01524 
01525 /** Set the components of a color by providing an array of atoms.
01526     If it is an array of 3 atoms, then the atoms provided should define the 
01527     red, green, and blue components (in this order) in a range of [0.0, 1.0].
01528     If a 4th atom is provided, it will define the alpha channel.
01529     If the alpha channel is not defined then it is assumed to be 1.0.
01530 
01531     @ingroup color
01532     @param  argc    The number of atoms in the array provided in argv.  
01533                     This should be 3 or 4 depending on whether or not the alpha channel is being provided.
01534     @param  argv    The address to the first of an array of atoms that define the color.
01535     @param  c       The address of a #t_jrgba struct for which the color will be defined.
01536     @return         A Max error code.       */
01537 t_max_err atoms_to_jrgba(long argc, t_atom *argv, t_jrgba *c);
01538 
01539 
01540 /** Set the components of a color.
01541     @ingroup color
01542     @param  prgba   The address of a #t_jrgba struct for which the color will be defined.
01543     @param  r       The value of the red component in a range of [0.0, 1.0].
01544     @param  g       The value of the green component in a range of [0.0, 1.0].
01545     @param  b       The value of the blue component in a range of [0.0, 1.0].
01546     @param  a       The value of the alpha component in a range of [0.0, 1.0].  */
01547 void jrgba_set(t_jrgba *prgba, double r, double g, double b, double a);
01548 
01549 
01550 /** Copy a color.
01551     @ingroup color
01552     @param  dest    The address of a #t_jrgba struct to which the color will be copied.
01553     @param  src     The address of a #t_jrgba struct from which the color will be copied.   */
01554 void jrgba_copy(t_jrgba *dest, t_jrgba *src);
01555 
01556 
01557 /** Compare two colors for equality.
01558     @ingroup color
01559     @param  rgba1   The address of a #t_jrgba struct to compare.
01560     @param  rgba2   The address of another #t_jrgba struct to compare.
01561     @return         returns 1 if rgba1 == rgba2.    */
01562 long jrgba_compare(t_jrgba *rgba1, t_jrgba *rgba2);
01563 
01564 
01565 /** Get a list of of filetypes appropriate for use with jgraphics surfaces.
01566     @ingroup            jgraphics
01567     @param  dummy       Unused.
01568     @param  count       The address of a variable to be set with the number of types in filetypes upon return.
01569     @param  filetypes   The address of a variable that will represent the array of file types upon return.
01570     @param  alloc       The address of a char that will be flagged with a 1 or a 0 depending on whether or not 
01571                         memory was allocated for the filetypes member.
01572 
01573     @remark This example shows a common usage of jgraphics_getfiletypes().
01574     @code
01575     char       filename[MAX_PATH_CHARS];
01576     long       *type = NULL;
01577     long       ntype;
01578     long       outtype;
01579     t_max_err  err;
01580     char       alloc;
01581     short      path;
01582     t_jsurface *surface;
01583     
01584     if (want_to_show_dialog) {
01585         jgraphics_getfiletypes(x, &ntype, &type, &alloc);
01586         err = open_dialog(filename, &path,(void *)&outtype, (void *)type, ntype);
01587         if (err)
01588             goto out;
01589     } 
01590     else {      
01591         strncpy_zero(filename, s->s_name, MAX_PATH_CHARS);
01592         err = locatefile_extended(filename, &path, &outtype, type, ntype);
01593         if (err)
01594             goto out;
01595     }
01596     surface = jgraphics_image_surface_create_referenced(filename, path); 
01597 out:
01598     if (alloc)
01599         sysmem_freeptr((char *)type);
01600     @endcode
01601 */
01602 void jgraphics_getfiletypes(void *dummy, long *count, long **filetypes, char *alloc);
01603 
01604 
01605 // boxlayer stuff
01606 
01607 /** Invalidate a layer, indicating that it needs to be re-drawn.
01608     @ingroup        boxlayer
01609     @param  b       The object/box to invalidate.
01610     @param  view    The patcherview for the object which should be invalidated, or NULL for all patcherviews.
01611     @param  name    The name of the layer to invalidate.
01612     @return         A Max error code.   */
01613 t_max_err jbox_invalidate_layer(t_object *b, t_object *view, t_symbol *name);
01614 
01615 // unused by any C74 code
01616 t_max_err jbox_remove_layer(t_object *b, t_object *view, t_symbol *name);
01617 
01618 /** Create a layer, and ready it for drawing commands.
01619     The layer drawing commands must be wrapped with a matching call to jbox_end_layer() 
01620     prior to calling jbox_paint_layer().
01621     
01622     @ingroup        boxlayer
01623     @param  b       The object/box to which the layer is attached.
01624     @param  view    The patcherview for the object to which the layer is attached.
01625     @param  name    A name for this layer.
01626     @param  width   The width of the layer.
01627     @param  height  The height of the layer.
01628     @return         A #t_jgraphics context for drawing into the layer.  */
01629 t_jgraphics* jbox_start_layer(t_object *b, t_object *view, t_symbol *name, double width, double height);
01630 
01631 /** Conclude a layer, indicating that it is complete and ready for painting.
01632     @ingroup        boxlayer
01633     @param  b       The object/box for the layer opened by jbox_start_layer().
01634     @param  view    The patcherview for the object opened by jbox_start_layer().
01635     @param  name    The name of the layer.
01636     @return         A Max error code.   */
01637 t_max_err jbox_end_layer(t_object *b, t_object *view, t_symbol *name);
01638 
01639 /** Paint a layer at a given position.
01640     @ingroup        boxlayer
01641     @param  b       The object/box to be painted.
01642     @param  view    The patcherview for the object which should be painted, or NULL for all patcherviews.
01643     @param  name    The name of the layer to paint.
01644     @param  x       The x-coordinate for the position at which to paint the layer.
01645     @param  y       The y-coordinate for the position at which to paint the layer.
01646     @return         A Max error code.   */
01647 t_max_err jbox_paint_layer(t_object *b, t_object *view, t_symbol *name, double x, double y);
01648 
01649 
01650 /** Simple utility to test for rectangle intersection.
01651     @ingroup        jgraphics
01652     @param  r1      The address of the first rect for the test.
01653     @param  r2      The address of the second rect for the test.
01654     @return         Returns true if the rects intersect, otherwise false.   */
01655 long jgraphics_rectintersectsrect(t_rect *r1, t_rect *r2);
01656 
01657 /** Simple utility to test for rectangle containment.
01658     @ingroup        jgraphics
01659     @param  outer   The address of the first rect for the test.
01660     @param  inner   The address of the second rect for the test.
01661     @return         Returns true if the inner rect is completely inside the outer rect,
01662                     otherwise false.    */
01663 long jgraphics_rectcontainsrect(t_rect *outer, t_rect *inner);
01664 
01665 /** Generate a #t_rect according to positioning rules.
01666     @ingroup                            jgraphics
01667     @param  positioned_rect             The address of a valid #t_rect whose members will be filled in upon return.
01668     @param  positioned_near_this_rect   A pointer to a rect near which this rect should be positioned.
01669     @param  keep_inside_this_rect       A pointer to a rect defining the limits within which the new rect must reside.  */
01670 void jgraphics_position_one_rect_near_another_rect_but_keep_inside_a_third_rect(
01671     t_rect *positioned_rect,
01672     const t_rect *positioned_near_this_rect,
01673     const t_rect *keep_inside_this_rect);
